datafield.subfield: Dànielle Nicole DeVoss, Martine Courant Rife, editors.

Introduction : Cultures and/of/in copyright / Dànielle Nicole DeVoss, Martine Courant Rife -- Part One. Cultural backdrops -- The limits of ownership in the United States / Aaron Barlow -- Scarlet v. SABAM : an emerging backlash against corporate copyright lobbies in Europe? / Angela Daly and Benjamin Farrand -- Discovery and ownership in an age of networked science / Michelle Sidler and Chad Wickman -- Hindered hope : Shepard Fairey and the Associated Press, and the missed opportunity to clarify U.S. copyright law / Ben McCorkle -- New digital production models : the consolidation of the copyleft / Joan Francesc Fondevila Gascón and Raúl López García-Navas -- "Not a category of constitutional significance" : Golan v. Holder and the future of the public domain / Traci Zimmerman -- Part two. Cultures of production -- Permissions and precedent : a cautionary tale from art publishing / Steve Westbrook and James Ryan -- Authorship and ownership of user contributions on the social web / Timothy R. Amidon and Jessica Reyman -- No copyright intended / Nicole Nguyen -- Fracturing digital entertainment by kindling rivalries and blowing steam / Liza Potts, Dean Holden, and Katie Dobruse -- Taking IP digital : a personal tale / Aaron Barlow -- Part three. Cultures of copyright -- Copyright and cultural use : tracing tensions between policy and practice in participatory cultures / Dave Jones -- Intellectual property and Jewish ethics : scripture as a resource for socioeconomic thought / Gabriel J. Michael -- Scratching out authorship : the creative network of Hip Hop DJs / André Sirois (DJ food stamp) -- Biocultural diversity and copyright : linking intellectual property, language, knowledge and environment / Gabriela Raquel Ríos and Donnie Johnson Sackey -- Toward a reflexive approach to remix, or, What Hawai'i Creole English and tourism can teach us about copyright / Jennifer Sano-Franchini, Robyn Tasaka, and Lehua Ledbetter -- Authorship abroad : considering copyright across cultures / Angela M. Shetler -- The mutual interests of multicultural studies and some rights reserved copyright / Jill M. Parrott -- Part four. Implications, actions and pedagogical work -- A culture of sharing : the U.S. nonprofit sector and intellectual property / Guiseppe Getto and Jessica Getto-Rivait -- Oppositional copyright curricula in the K-12 classroom / Clancy Ratliff -- Using eco-feminism to sustain the Open Educational Resources movement in a corporatized culture / Laural Lea Adams -- Borrowed images : a studio arts conundrum / Lisa Evans -- Cultural critique, first-year composition, and copyright / Jen Ware, Ashley Hall, and Sydney Stegall -- Asking the right questions / Nancy Schrock.
